headline.main: Afghan Rebels Report Capture Of Major City From the Taliban

lead_paragraph: Forces opposed to the Taliban have captured the key northern city of Mazar-i-Sharif after a days of bombing and a firefight that sent Taliban forces fleeing, both rebel and Taliban officials said today. Control of the town will give the rebels an important airfield and the route north to Uzbekistan, where American soldiers are stationed 100 miles over the border. The White House had no immediate comment, but American officials confirmed that opposition forces were in the city and said fighters of the ruling Islamic militia were on the run.
abstract: Afghanistan's rebel Northern Alliance takes key northern city of Mazar-i-Sharif after days of bombing by United States planes and firefight that sent Taliban forces fleeing; control of town will give rebels key airfield and route north to Uzbekistan, where American soldiers are stationed; Northern Alliance aide Atiqullah Baryalai says Taliban has also abandoned base near Hairatan on Uzbekistan border; says his troops are pursuing retreating Taliban; maps (M)
